law.catch_line: Forms for proof of loss furnished.
law.text: An insurer shall furnish upon written request of any person claiming to have a loss under any insurance contract, forms of proof of loss for completion by such person, but such insurer shall not, by reason of the requirement so to furnish forms, have any responsibility or liability for or with reference to the completion of such proof or the manner of any such completion or attempted completion.
law.history: Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 14, sec. 27, effective June 18, 1970.
